awd_titl_txt: Travel: Request for Student Travel Support for the 48th International Conference on Very Large Databases 2022
awd_abstract_narration:
The provided support will enable United States-based students to attend and participate in the 48th International Conference on Very Large Databases (VLDB 2022) to be held in Sydney, Australia from September 5, 2022 to September 9, 2022 (https://vldb.org/2022). The VLDB conferences are a premier international technical event centered on various aspects of database research and practice. The VLDB conference provides a forum that promotes students and researchers to identify scientific foundations for building large-scale database management systems that can work ever more effectively. Efforts will be made to broaden the participation of underrepresented students and researchers. The conference will thus contribute directly to training the next generation of scientists who are both consumers and developers of technology in database management system design and implementation. The involvement of United States-based students will have a direct impact in creating a highly-qualified workforce who can take on the emerging data science challenges of the future.

Database research profoundly influences domains that include health sciences, the emerging field of Internet of Things (IoT), service-oriented computing, real-time business analytics, and social computing. The VLDB conference series provides researchers and practitioners from academia, industry and government agencies with an excellent opportunity to share their research and experiences on all aspects of data management and analysis at scale. The aims of the conference are multi-fold: (1) to provide an international forum for sharing research results related to the investigation of major challenges in next-generation database research; (2) to stimulate interactive discussions on research in the database area through panels, posters, tutorials, student scholar roundtables, etc.; and (3) to motivate and engage future generations of researchers via the many conference and workshop presentations, interactive poster sessions, and panel and breakout sessions. The VLDB 2020 Proceedings will be broadly accessible at http://www.vldb.org/pvldb/.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
NSF funding was used to support travel by 8  students from US universities to Sydney Australia  for VLDB 2022  and an additional 20 students to attend VLDB 2023.

VLDB, now in its 50th  year, is a premier annual international forum for data management and database researchers, vendors, practitioners, application developers, and users.  The VLDB conference provides a forum dedicated to the dissemination of original research, the discussion of practical insights, and the reporting of experiences relevant to data management research. In addition to providing a forum for research papers, the VLDB conference provides people from academia and industry with an opportunity to exchange ideas through industrial papers and demo papers. Additionally, a affiliated PhD workshop attracts international students in their early career phase and allows the open discussion of their research ideas. Over the years, with the emergence of  cloud computing, big data, machine learning, generative AI,  and data science, and the central role of database research and practice in these fields, the number of participants in the VLDB conference has steadily increased. VLDB, in recent years, has attracted 1000+  attendees from around the world; the participation tends to be evenly balanced between students and faculty and  professional researchers.

Attending VLDB enabled students to present their research to a broad audience, to develop contacts with other researchers in academia and industry working in related areas, to seek internship opportunities, to explore job prospects, to develop collaborations, and so on. Several  of the recipients of the travel grant wrote strong testimonials highlighting the important role that the NSF travel support played in their career.
